column1: #Text=Because you can't just go to city hall and get a license to operate a cab company like you would for a pet license, drivers license, etc.
#Text=The supply of these licenses is artificially restricted, and that's a huge part of the problem.City hall needs to get out of the way and allow the free market to take over.

#Text=For sure, they can set reasonable standards to prevent abuses - and some of the tactics of uber, like surge pricing during a terrorist attack certainly are abusive - but these standards need not include an artificial limit on the number of taxis on the road.
